intro: Vernonia apoensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and upland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Vernonia apoensis plays an important ecological role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining native plant communities.
